data.title: Suggested commands have a weird sort order
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.9.0
- OS Version: Windows 10 Enterprise 2015 LTSB (were unable to locate build number)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Start searching for commands (e.g Ctrl+Shift+P)
2. Type: install extensions
3. The sort order should now not prioritize exact match, but rather keep it at the bottom (see attached image)

![visual studio code - sort order](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1063362/22584021/6e065942-e9f0-11e6-800d-46e29002c54d.png)

This is just something small and a bit edge case, due to there ain't that many commands which match with others (if there even is any more then this case).

data.title: When a file is modified by extensions , it loses the undo history.
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.9
- OS Version: Linux

Steps to Reproduce:

1. install vscode-prettydiff from extension market place.
2. made some changes to a file.
3. run it to beautify the file. `Ctrl + Shift + P` : `Prettify using Prettydiff`

Source :

https://github.com/HexcodeTechnologies/vscode-prettydiff/blob/master/extension.js
I do believe extensions should not discard undo history.

data.title: Node debugging does not work after update
data.body:
Node debugging stopped working after the latest update to version 1.9
Debugger starts listening on port XXX then freezes on the warning message that it is experimental feature. Any help?

- VSCode Version: January 2017 (version 1.9)
- OS Version: Windows 10 Pro version 1607

launch.json

``` json{
    "version": "0.2.0",
    "configurations": [
        {
            "name": "Launch",
            "type": "node2",
            "request": "launch",
            "program": "${workspaceRoot}/index.js",
            "stopOnEntry": false,
            "args": [],
            "cwd": "${workspaceRoot}",
            "preLaunchTask": null,
            "runtimeExecutable": null,
            "runtimeArgs": [
                "--nolazy",
                "--preserve-symlinks"
            ],
            "env": {
                "NODE_ENV": "development",
                "NODE_PATH":"dev"
            },
            "sourceMaps": false,
            "outFiles": []
        },
        {
            "name": "Attach",
            "type": "node",
            "request": "attach",
            "port": 5858,
            "address": "localhost",
            "restart": false,
            "sourceMaps": false,
            "outFiles": [],
            "localRoot": "${workspaceRoot}",
            "remoteRoot": null
        },
        {
            "name": "Attach to Process",
            "type": "node",
            "request": "attach",
            "processId": "${command.PickProcess}",
            "port": 5858,
            "sourceMaps": false,
            "outFiles": []
        }
    ]
}
```

data.title: The message "The TypeScript language service died unexpectedly 5 times in the last 5 minutes" keeps flickering above my file tabs all the time.
data.body:
The message "The TypeScript language service died unexpectedly 5 times in the last 5 minutes" keeps flickering above my file tabs all the time. I Googled this and fixed it temporary but then it started again. I cannot see that it is depending on me as an user since I don't use TypeScript and haven't changed anything about it. I have not found any way to in install the TypeScript Language Service.

It is wery annoying and sad since I really like Visual Studio Code. But I will not continue using it if I am forced to have this flickering and cannot reach the file-tabs when I use it. There are too many good competitors I can use instead.

data.title: Braces/brackets/parentheses matching is slow on big files

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.9.0
- OS Version: xubuntu 16.10

About:
```
Version 1.9.0
Commit 27240e71ef390bf2d66307e677c2a333cebf75af
Date 2017-02-02T08:21:13.228Z
Shell 1.4.6
Renderer 53.0.2785.143
Node 6.5.0
```
Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open big file (i have ~2000 lines)
2. Go to the center/end of file
3. Try typing closing brace/bracket/parenthesis and type anything after

the stuff you typed after closing brace/bracket/parenthesis will be inserted after several seconds

data.title: workbench.action.terminal.runSelectedText w/PowerShell inserts extraneous >>
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.9.0
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Make sure PowerShell is the active shell
2. Type any shell command into an editor, highlight it, open the command palette, and run the "Run Selected Text in Active Terminal" command
3. After running the command, ">>" will be appended to the line after the prompt line

Expected behavior:
Nothing should be inserted after the prompt line

In the image below, the first command was run directly in the terminal and outputs correctly. The second command was run by using the "Run Selected Text in Active Terminal" command on the text in the editor. After this command ran, an extraneous ">>" appears after the new terminal prompt.

![capture](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6452466/22581007/8974097a-e9a2-11e6-91e0-bc2bdeb15ce4.JPG)

data.title: Debug Console panel font cannot be changed
data.body: - VSCode Version: 1.9 - OS Version: Mac OS 10.12 - No extensions ## Steps to Reproduce: 1. Go to settings and change `editor.fontFamily` and `terminal.integrated.fontFamily` 2. Save 3. Open Debug Console 4. Notice font is jarringly different I want to be able to customize the Debug Console font family and size so that I can see consistent character spacing and readability throughout the panels of the application that provide output. Currently, VSCode only allows you to change the font family and size in the editor and terminal. ## See attached image:

data.title: ghci in integrated Terminal doesn't go to newline on reaching line width limit

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.9.0 (27240e71ef390bf2d66307e677c2a333cebf75af, 2017-02-02T08:31:00.827Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|vscode-npm-source|dkundel|1.0.0|
|githistory|donjayamanne|0.1.5|
|python|donjayamanne|0.5.6|
|language-haskell|justusadam|1.4.4|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. have haskell's ghci installed
2. open terminal (ctrl + `)
2. run ghci
3. type a long line longer than the window width
4, observe line doesn't go to new line, stays on same line
5. observe the very rightmost character on edge of terminal keep getting replaced by the new characters being typed

Doesn't seem to happen in node's and python's interactive environment.

data.title: Improve concurrency of git commands

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.9.0 (27240e71ef390bf2d66307e677c2a333cebf75af, 2017-02-02T08:31:00.827Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|vscode-twig-pack|bajdzis|1.0.0|
|githistory|donjayamanne|0.1.5|
|python|donjayamanne|0.5.7|
|xml|DotJoshJohnson|1.7.0|
|vscode-html-css|ecmel|0.0.33|
|live-html-previewer|hdg|0.0.1|
|vscode-apache|mrmlnc|1.1.0|
|mssql|ms-mssql|0.2.0|
|csharp|ms-vscode|1.6.2|
|team|ms-vsts|1.108.0|
|vscode-docker|PeterJausovec|0.0.11|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a git repo.
2. Create 2 or more files.
3. Add each file to staging individually, without waiting for previous file to be shown as staged.
4. VS Code will show the error `There was an issue running a git operation. Please review the output or use a console to check the state of your repository.`

This kind of issue can be encountered in git itself if using 2 terminals for the same repo. Reason this is a VS Code issue and not git (git should throw an error for this to prevent corruptions), is that VS Code is aggressively refreshing the git status after each file is added, creating an increased likelihood for it to trip over its own git operation.

|elm|sbrink|0.8.3|
|JavaScriptSnippets|xabikos|1.2.0|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. create a.js file contains something like `MyComponent.prototype.helloWorld = function(){}`
2. create b.js file `function myHello() {}`
3. type cmd+shift+o + `"hello"` in file `a.js` shows helloWorld function
4. type cmd+shift+o + `"hello"` in file `b.js` shows myHello function
5. type cmd+t + `"hello"` in file `a.js` shows myHello function
6. type cmd+t + `"hello"` in file `b.js` shows myHello function

I expect that in step 5/6 both helloWorld and myHello function would show up, but only function declaration was showed up. Is their any way to show both of them?

data.title: Allow MarkedString in CompletionItem details and documentation
data.body: part of #11877 This allows marked strings to be used in the `detail` and `documentation` field of completion items. I've tried to preseve the existing behavior as much as possible with this change. The new rendering will only be applied when an array of marked strings is passed in

data.title: window.menuBarVisibility setting is not respected on restart
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.9.0
- OS Version: Windows 8.1

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Set `"window.menuBarVisibility": "hidden"`
2. Close and reopen VSCode

On my computer, the menu bar is visible upon reopening VSCode. You cannot even toggle it off with `alt`.
